content: This list is incomplete; you can help by adding missing items. *(September 2020)* This is a **list of [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) [inventions](/wiki/Invention) and [discoveries](/wiki/Discovery_(observation))**. ## Food, food techniques and cuisine ### Food - **[Bak chor mee](/wiki/Mee_pok#Bak_chor_mee)**, which translates to [minced meat](/wiki/Ground_meat) [noodles](/wiki/Noodles), is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine) noodle dish common in hawker centres. The noodles are tossed in vinegar, minced meat, pork slices, pork liver, stewed sliced mushrooms, meat balls and bits of deep-fried lard. The dish can be categorised into two variants: a dry version and a soup version. Most dry versions come with slices of stewed mushroom, minced pork, slices of lean pork and sometimes fried [anchovies](/wiki/Anchovies), atop noodles tossed in a chilli-vinegar sauce, while soup versions include a pork flavoured broth. - **[Chilli crab](/wiki/Chilli_crab)** is considered one of Singapore's national dishes, it was invented in 1956 by a Singaporean couple and was originally sold from a [push cart](/wiki/Food_cart). In 1963, another famous chef adapted the dish into a sourer version which became the common version seen in Singapore. - **[Hainanese chicken rice](/wiki/Hainanese_chicken_rice)**, also considered one of Singapore's national dishes. It was first invented by Hainanese immigrants in Singapore during the 1920s. - **[Kaya toast](/wiki/Kaya_toast)** is a well known Singaporean snack commonly eaten during [breakfast](/wiki/Breakfast) or afternoon [tea](/wiki/Tea_(meal)). - **[Katong laksa](/wiki/Katong_laksa)** is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) variant of the spicy noodle soup [laksa](/wiki/Laksa) inspired by people who live in the precinct of [Katong](/wiki/Katong) located in eastern [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ### Drink - **[Kopi](/wiki/Kopi_(drink))** is a type of traditional coffee originating from [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Invented in the early 20th century at the now [Downtown Core](/wiki/Downtown_Core) such as [Chinatown](/wiki/Chinatown,_Singapore), it is a highly caffeinated black [coffee](/wiki/Coffee) served with [condensed milk](/wiki/Condensed_milk). It usually goes along with kaya toast, another Singaporean dish. There are more than one type of kopi, there is also kopi o, which means that there is no milk added and also kopi c, which adds evaporated milk. These are the words that local singaporeans use to oder kopi in kopitiams around singapore. - The **[Singapore Sling](/wiki/Singapore_Sling)** is a gin-based [sling](/wiki/Sling_(cocktail)) [cocktail](/wiki/Cocktail) invented in 1915 by Singaporean bartender Ngiam Tong Boon at the [Raffles Hotel](/wiki/Raffles_Hotel) in Singapore. - **[Milo dinosaur](/wiki/Milo_dinosaur)** is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) [chocolate](/wiki/Chocolate) [malt](/wiki/Malt)–based beverage most commonly found in [hawker centres](/wiki/Hawker_centre). ## Science and technology ### Audio technology - **[Sound Blaster](/wiki/Sound_Blaster)**, invented by [Sim Wong Hoo](/wiki/Sim_Wong_Hoo) and his company [Creative Technology](/wiki/Creative_Technology) (known as **Creative Labs** in the United States). ### Medicinal technology - The **ARCT-021** [vaccine](/wiki/Vaccine) for [COVID-19](/wiki/COVID-19), developed by Singaporean scientists at the [Duke–NUS Medical School](/wiki/Duke%E2%80%93NUS_Medical_School). ### Visual technology - **[Virtual museums](/wiki/Virtual_museum)** were first invented by [Lin Hsin Hsin](/wiki/Lin_Hsin_Hsin) at the [Lin Hsin Hsin Art Museum](/wiki/Lin_Hsin_Hsin_Art_Museum) in 1994. At the time, its technology was considered the first of its kind during the initial expansion of the [World Wide Web](/wiki/World_Wide_Web). ### Agricultural Singapore is a land-scarce country, and so, it is dependent on imports. *Vertical farming platforms* hopes to improve Singapore's situation. - [Culture of Singapore](/wiki/Culture_of_Singapore) - [History of typography in East Asia](/wiki/History_of_typography_in_East_Asia) - [List of Chinese discoveries](/wiki/List_of_Chinese_discoveries) - [List of Chinese inventions](/wiki/List_of_Chinese_inventions) - [List of Japanese inventions and discoveries](/wiki/List_of_Japanese_inventions_and_discoveries) - [List of Korean inventions and discoveries](/wiki/List_of_Korean_inventions_and_discoveries) - [List of Taiwanese inventions and discoveries](/wiki/List_of_Taiwanese_inventions_and_discoveries) - [List of Vietnamese inventions and discoveries](/wiki/List_of_Vietnamese_inventions_and_discoveries) Portals: - Asia - Singapore - Food - Drink - Technology
